Hey guys, I have an issue with HubSpot not minifying my CSS file. I've read that HubSpot automatically makes a .min.css file but when I use SEMrush in my website I get a lot of warnings coming from my CSS file. I also tried to minify the file myself but that CSS also contains some hubL code and it doesn't work because of that. Am I missing something or just because of the hubL code I cannot make this file .min?

I find HubSpot’s CSS minification to be super finicky. Based on my conversations with Support, you should check that your CSS:

- doesn’t contain any `@supports`
- doesn’t have unbalanced block comments (`/* /* */`)
- doesn’t contain `0s` anywhere
- doesn’t use `0%` in an rgba/rgba/hsla/linear-gradient declaration
HubSpot support should be able to tell you if there are any further issues

Also:
 - can’t contain any (calc x - y) in the stylesheet
